title: Twitter Experiments With New Features
teaser: Some of the tested features aren't being well received. One new feature displays publicly which tweets a user has "favorited."
contentencoded:
Social media platform Twitter has been testing new features in users’ feeds. One new feature displays publicly which tweets a user has “favorited” — information that has previously been only available to the user and the recipient of the “favorite” designation.

Some of the tested features aren’t being well received, drawing comparisons to Facebook. Here & Now media analyst discusses the new features and reaction with host Robin Young.

Guest

  • John Carroll, Here & Now media analyst and professor of mass communications at Boston University. His blog is “Campaign Outsider” and he tweets @johncarroll_bu.
